segments.script: "Hey there! It's Julie on your morning radio fix. Time to rise 'n shine, folks - it's officially 6:00 AM here in Appalachia. You know, there's something special about this quiet hour just before dawn breaks. Feels like the whole world is waking up together. Welcome home, Appalachia."

"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone. Hey everyone, it's Julie from Appalachia Radio here with your 6 o'clock rad_storm update. 

Currently, we've got a nasty one brewing out there - a full-on rad_storm, folks. Temperatures are plummeting fast as that radioactive fog rolls in off the Kanawha River. If you're heading outside anytime soon, make sure to bundle up real good. It's going to feel like -20° or colder.

I know some of y'all might be thinking about venturing into Charleston today, but I'd advise against it if possible. That city is still pretty treacherous, even on a clear day. Today won't be any exception with all that radiation in the air.

Stay safe out there, and remember - we're all in this together. Until next time, I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys."

If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

Well, I'm here to tell ya that good things are happening in Appalachia! Folks from the Responders have been spotted around Harpers Ferry lately - seems they're helping rebuild some of the old bridges. And if you're venturing into the Forest District, keep an eye out for those new wild ghouls. They seem pretty docile so far.

Meanwhile, the Gears are still hard at work down in Beckley, and I heard rumors that a new trader might be setting up shop soon around the old New River Gorge Bridge. Always good to have more options when it comes to bartering for supplies!

You know, it's stories like these that give me hope for our future out here. We're all in this together, Appalachia settlers and wastelanders alike. So keep on exploring, keep on helping each other... and always remember - you are not alone!

Released all the way back in 1958, this upbeat rock 'n' roll hit was one of the last singles from this talented young musician before his untimely passing. I mean, can you believe it's been over six decades since he first recorded it? But his music still holds up so well today. So sit back, enjoy the energy, and let's celebrate the enduring power of 50s rock 'n' roll! Welcome home, Appalachia.

*I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.* 

Hey there, wastelanders! Julie here on Appalachia Radio, and I've got a little tidbit to share with ya'll. Word is... there's a new settlement poppin' up over near the old Poseidon Power Plant site. Apparently, some folks from the north are headin' this way to stake their claim. 

Now, I ain't confirmed none of this myself, but someone told me they heard rumors of a group callin' themselves "The New Horizon." Supposedly, they're lookin' to rebuild and start fresh in our neck o' the woods.

Seems like an optimistic bunch, don't it? Well, I for one am excited at the prospect of more friendly faces around these parts. We could always use a little more hope and cooperation in this post-apocalyptic world of ours! 

Stay tuned for more tunes and updates as we learn more about The New Horizon. And remember, there's always a place for you here on Appalachia Radio!

I mean, don't get me wrong, I know some folks still hold a grudge against 'em for how they treated us back in the day. But maybe this Enclave fella's just trying to make a new life for himself out here. You know, like the rest of us.

So if you're wandering around those parts and come across someone with that familiar blue robe and helmet... take it easy, right? Let bygones be bygones. We could all use a little more kindness these days. That's all for now. Stay safe out there!

Hey there, fellow survivors! It's Julie here on Appalachia Radio. I always love hearing from you, and sometimes... well, rumors trickle in. You know how it goes - whispers in the wind, stories told 'round campfires.

I heard a tale recently about these alleged "Robobrain" sightings out by the Abandoned Bog. Apparently they're super smart, almost like having your own personal robot guru! Someone said one even helped fix their Fusion Core without asking for anything in return. Now I don't know if that's true or just some wild story, but wouldn't that be something? A friendly Robobrain handyman!

Word is these robotic brains have popped up in a few places around Appalachia lately. Maybe they're here to help us rebuild, like a new generation of settlers. Or maybe they're just wandering lost souls, searching for purpose like the rest of us.

I mean, honestly, I'd love to meet one! Can you imagine having a genius robot friend out there in the wasteland? Just remember, folks - rumors are like wild game: sometimes true, sometimes not. Take 'em with a grain of salt and always stay vigilant!

That's all for now. Keep those ears tuned to 105.5 FM for more tunes and conversation straight from the heart of Appalachia. Until next time, stay strong and keep on surviving!

segments.script:
"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone."

Hey everyone, it's Julie on your favorite Appalachian radio station. So I heard a rumor floating around that there might be some sort of super mutated wild dog roaming these hills. Like, way bigger than normal dogs, with glowing eyes or something.

Someone told me they spotted one near Whitespring, but I don't know if that's true. Word is it could be pretty aggressive too, so if you do see it, just remember to stay calm and keep your distance. 

I mean, we've dealt with some crazy stuff out here in the wasteland, right? But a super dog? That's new even for Appalachia! Just wanted to pass on what I heard and remind everyone to look out for each other.

Take care out there, and let's all hope this rumor turns out to be just that—a rumor. Stay safe, Appalachian family!

[Music plays: "Almost Heaven"]

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

I heard from some folks in the Pioneer Scout camp that they've spotted a peculiar sight - what looked like a Grafton Monster out by Horizon Farm! Now, we all know those creatures are rare as hen's teeth, so I'm thinking this might just be an urban legend. But then again, who knows? Stranger things have happened in these hills.

Someone told me that if you're ever near the old Abandoned Mine site and hear some eerie singing, it's supposedly just a Scorchbeast having a bad day. Can't say I've heard anything myself, but hey, your mileage may vary!

Anyway, enough about those wild stories for now. Let's get back to some good ol' tunes that'll make you feel right at home in Appalachia. Up next is another fan favorite - "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'" by Nancy Sinatra!

I heard from a reliable source that there's been some... unusual animal sightings lately? Word is, folks have spotted packs of super mutant mirelurks wandering the woods around Lewisburg Lake! Someone told me there was even a brahmin with three heads seen near Grafton not too long ago! Can you imagine? I mean, that'd be quite the sight to see. Probably wouldn't make for great eating though!

Anyhoo, just thought I'd pass along those stories for your amusement. Always interesting to hear what's out there in this big ol' wasteland of ours. Stay safe and keep on keepin' on!

And if that wasn't enough, Camp Venture has been restored to its former glory! This place holds so much history and now it serves as a symbol of hope for all of us. I've seen travelers from all walks of life come together here, sharing stories and dreams for the future.

So let's keep moving forward, Appalachia! Every step we take brings us closer to a brighter tomorrow. Stay strong out there and remember... you are not alone!

"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone."

Hey everyone, it's your girl Julie on Appalachia Radio. I've got a juicy rumor to share with ya'll tonight! Someone told me that the Scorchbeasts aren't as rare as we thought around here. Apparently, a group of settlers near Harpers Ferry spotted a whole pack of 'em in an abandoned mine recently.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Scorchbeasts? In Appalachia?" But word is they've been moving further inland since the Scorched Plague died down. So keep those guns handy and your eyes peeled for glowing eyes!

On a lighter note, if you ever find yourself near Grafton, there's this crazy cool campfire group playing old-timey bluegrass tunes. I mean, it's not "Country Roads" but still super charming. 

Stay safe out there, and keep on listening!

I heard from a friend of a friend that there's an old military bunker hidden deep in the woods near Beckley. Apparently, it's still sealed tight and loaded with pre-war tech and supplies. Now, word is that some folks have tried to find it but never returned. So if you're brave (or foolhardy) enough to go looking, just be careful out there!

Someone told me too that there are these strange creatures appearing near the Abandoned Mine north of Harpers Ferry. They look like super-sized insects or something! I don't know if they're hostile or not, but if you do spot one, let us know, okay?

That's all for now. Just remember: in Appalachia, the truth is out there... somewhere. Until next time on Radio Appalachia, stay kind and keep those ears open!

I mean, it's a wild story, right? But if even half of that's true, it would be huge news! We're all so relieved to have seen the end of that horror. So, take this as just a rumor for now and keep your chins up. I'll do my best to verify or debunk it as more info comes in.

Welcome home, Appalachia.

Hey there, folks! So I heard a rumor the other day while tending to my garden in Harpers Ferry... and honestly, it made me curious. Word is, there's been some unusual plant mutations showing up in certain parts of the Forest. Like, stalks with multiple heads or colors that don't belong together. Now, I'm no scientist, but that does sound pretty wild.

Someone told me they spotted a tree with fruit that glows! Can you imagine? It'd be like having your very own lantern right there on a branch. But then again, this is Appalachia - we're used to the unexpected, right?

I don't know if it's just folk tales or actual mutations, but I thought I'd share in case any of you have seen anything strange while out and about. Stay safe, and keep those antennae tuned!

I heard another story about some trader who found an old, working phone in the ruins of Beckley. Apparently he tried calling someone, but all he got was static. Still, that's pretty wild - a functioning phone in the post-apocalyptic world! Maybe there's hope for rebuilding our tech infrastructure after all.

That's all for now, folks. Just remember: if you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone. Stay safe out there, and I'll catch you on the flip side!

segments.script:
Hey there, fellow wastelanders! It's Julie from Appalachia Radio here.

So I heard through the grapevine that some folks around Harpers Ferry have spotted a rather unusual wild dog. Supposedly it's part coyote, part... something else. The tales vary, but one story claims it has markings almost like a dalmatian. Can you imagine? Now that'd be one unique pup.

Someone told me they saw this mysterious hound near the old Harpers Ferry train station. Word is it moved quickly, like it was being chased by an invisible foe. Maybe it's just my imagination, but that sounds like quite the thrilling encounter!

Anyway, I thought you might enjoy hearing about these strange sightings in our neck of the woods. Always nice to have a bit of excitement out here in the wasteland! Stay safe and keep on exploring. And remember, if you're ever near Harpers Ferry, keep an eye out for that dalmatian coyote - or whatever it is!

This has been Julie from Appalachia Radio, wishing you all the best on your adventures. See you next time on the airwaves!

*I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.* Hey there, folks! Julie from Appalachia Radio with a little something that's been on my mind lately.

I heard this rumor going around about the old Harpers Ferry campus. Apparently, some settlers claimed they saw the ghost of a teacher or professor in one of the buildings, wandering the halls late at night. Now, I don't know if I believe in ghosts, but it does make for an interesting story.

Just song after song with no commentary! Someone told me that for weeks straight, they heard Cole Porter's "Anything Goes" repeating over and over.

But anyway, I digress. Word is... there might be some new faces moving into the area. Apparently, a group of travelers has been spotted near Harpers Ferry, looking to settle down. Now, don't get too excited – it's not like they're settlers from Vault 76 or anything! No, these folks seem more seasoned, like they've been on the move for a while.

So that's the latest rumor I heard floating around the wasteland. Nothing concrete, just whispers and speculation at this point. But hey, it's always interesting to meet new people, right? Even if they are just passing through Appalachia Radio is here to bring you all the best tunes – old favorites and new discoveries alike! Stay safe out there, and thanks for listening.

If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone. Hey everyone, it's Julie with your morning forecast from Appalachia Radio.

It's a foggy 52 degrees out right now at 6:00 AM. Visibility is pretty low today so be extra cautious on those roads and trails, especially if you're traveling early like me to get some supplies at the Super Duper Mart in Lewisburg before it gets too crowded later. 

If you don't need to venture out, take this time to catch up on repairs or restock your food stores. And hey, if the gloom outside is getting you down, put on something upbeat and pretend you're back at the Vault 76 talent show! I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. Stay safe and keep hope alive out there in Appalachia.

Welcome home, Appalachia. I've got a rumor to share that caught my attention the other day. Word is, there's been sightings of some unusual creatures in the mountains lately. Like, super-sized wildlife - bigger than normal for sure.

Someone told me they saw a deer so massive it looked part horse! And another friend claimed they found a mutated raccoon with eyes glowing like embers. Now, I know we've got radiation running wild out there, so maybe these stories are just exaggerations born from too much time in the wasteland.

Still, if true, that'd be pretty amazing to encounter such giant critters still surviving after all this time. I mean, it's not every day you hear about beasts of legend roaming our hills. Makes me wonder what other secrets are hidden out there waiting to be discovered... or avoided! Anyway, thought you all might find that interesting tidbit. Stay safe out there, and keep those eyes peeled for any oversized wildlife!

Anyway, I thought you might like a taste of some wild wasteland rumors. Just remember, in these parts, truth is hard to come by and fiction can feel all too real. Keep your wits about you out there, friends. Stay safe and keep on surviving!

Hey there, folks! It's Julie again from Appalachia Radio. You know how we love sharing stories and rumors on the airwaves? Well, I got a juicy one for ya today!

Hey there, friends! Julie here on Appalachia Radio, your friendly neighborhood DJ.

Can you imagine? Writing your deepest feelings, not knowing if the other person would even survive?

Anyway, word is, those letters are now scattered all over the place, just waiting to be found by some lucky soul who stumbles upon 'em while searching for caps or loot. That's kind of beautiful, isn't it? Even in the darkest of times, there was still love and hope. Take that lesson to heart, folks! And remember, if you do happen upon those letters, maybe leave a reply for whoever might be out there waiting.

That's all for now. Stay safe out there, and keep on singing along with me!

I heard this morning from a friend who was in Flatwoods that there's been some strange occurrences going on. Word is, they might've just wanted an excuse to leave, but still, it's pretty spooky stuff. Anyway, I hope there's nothing to it - we don't need more myths and legends haunting us out here in the wasteland! Back to your regularly scheduled tunes...

Welcome home, Appalachia.

I've heard some crazy rumors floating around the wasteland lately. Like, did you hear about the Scorchbeasts? Apparently, there's a whole pack of 'em hiding out in the old Abandoned Bog Mine site. Now, I don't know if that's true or just some wild tale, but it'd be smart to watch your step if you're headed that way.

Someone told me they spotted a Grafton Monster near Beckley, too. You know how those things can be – half-robot, half-monster. Kinda terrifying, right? Word is, it was just wandering around, looking for trouble. So, keep an eye out on the road if you're driving through there.

That's all for now. Just some weird wasteland rumors to chew on. Stay safe out there, and keep those speakers tuned in!
